params.name: paging.cursor
params.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of recipients for a selected campaign based on a specific recipient activity.

Pages are returned with a maximum of 1,000 recipients per page and defaults to 40 recipients per page.

Use [List Statistics](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/email-marketing/campaign/list-statistics) to retrieve a list of activity for selected campaigns. 
Use [List Campaigns](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/email-marketing/campaign/list-campaigns) to retrieve additional information for your campaigns.

> __Note__: If no `activity` is included, this endpoint returns an error.

permissions.name: Read Email Marketing
permissions.description: Request permission to read email marketing data

params.name: campaignIds
params.doc:
IDs of the campaigns to retrieve.  

Max: 100 campaigns

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of statistics for up to 100 selected campaigns.

For each campaign, you receive the total activity count for the campaign's landing page and email. For example, the total 
amount of times the landing page was opened, or the total amount of email recipients that clicked a link in an email.

Use [List Campaigns](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/email-marketing/campaign/list-campaigns) to retrieve additional information for your campaigns.
Use [List Recipients](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/email-marketing/campaign/list-recipients) to retrieve a list of recipients and their activities related to a selected campaign.

permissions.name: Read Email Marketing
permissions.description: Request permission to read email marketing data

docs.summary:
Triggered each time an email campaign has a new recipient activity.  

New recipient activity includes when each email in a campaign is `DELIVERED`, `OPENED`, 
or `BOUNCED`. Also, when a URL inside the email is `CLICKED`.

The type of activity that triggered the webhook is in `actionEvent.body` and can be one of:
+ `delivery`: Email was delivered to recipient.
+ `click`: Recipient clicked on a URL in an email.
+ `open`: Recipient opened an email.
+ `softBounce`: Email soft bounced when sent to a recipient.
+ `hardBounce`: Email hard bounced when sent to a recipient.

docs.summary:
An account can be active or in some state of suspension (warned/suspended/banned).
 If a user is in a state of suspension they must visit their email marketing account in the Wix business manager and follow the instructions.

members.name: dateTo
members.doc: Current quota period end date - after which quota will roll over.

members.name: quotaUsage
members.doc: Information about allocated quota already used in this period.

members.name: campaigns
members.doc: Number of allocated marketing campaigns per month (-1 means unlimited).

members.name: emails
members.doc: Number of allocated individual emails per month.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: title
members.doc:
Marketing campaign title. For sent campaigns this will match the email subject if subject was not explicitly provided on sending.
 For published campaigns - the title will be the first line of text.

members.name: firstImageUrl
members.doc: URL of first image after the logo.

members.name: snapshotImageUrl
members.doc: URL of the landing page snapshot.

members.name: editorType
members.doc: Editor type. Either web app, or mobile app.

members.name: publishingData
members.doc: Publishing data (present only if campaign is published).

members.name: total
members.doc: Combined landing page and email distribution statistics.

members.name: opened
members.doc: Number of times landing page was loaded or viewed.

members.name: clicked
members.doc: Number of times a link was clicked in landing page.

docs.summary: unique

members.name: opened
members.doc:
Number of recipients who opened an email.  

If a single recipient opens an email twice, it is counted as one unique open.

members.name: clicked
members.doc:
Number of recipients who clicked a link in the email.  

If a single recipient clicks a link in an email twice, it is counted as one unique click. 
If a single recipient clicks different links in an email, it is counted as one unique click.

members.name: complained
members.doc: Number of recipients who reported email as spam.

members.name: notSent
members.doc: Number of emails not sent because the campaign was terminated.

members.name: opened
members.doc: Number of landing page views + emails opened.

members.name: clicked
members.doc: Number of landing page link clicks + email link clicks.

docs.summary:
Money.
 Default format to use. Sufficiently compliant with majority of standards: w3c, ISO 4217, ISO 20022, ISO 8583:2003.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

members.name: formattedValue
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string in local format (e.g., 1 000,30). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: optional time zone is the full name. example: "Asia/Jerusalem"

members.name: softBounce
members.doc:
Email soft bounced when sent to a recipient.  

Indicates a temporary issue sending your email. For example, the email server receiving the email is under a heavy load. 
For soft bounces, you should wait and try again at a later time.

members.name: hardBounce
members.doc:
Email hard bounced when sent to a recipient.  

Indicates a permanent error sending your email. For example, the email address does not exist.

docs.summary:
Contains information about what will be displayed as the sender's email and name.
 If public email domains (@gmail.com, @yahoo.com, etc.) are used for sending email campaigns, they will not be displayed in the 'from' header.
 Instead, they will be replaced with @pb0x.ascendbywix.com, and the sender's email will be placed in the 'reply-to' header.
 If the user uses an email from a Wix managed domain to send campaigns, that email will be displayed in the 'from' header.
 If the user uses an email from a custom domain that is not managed by Wix, a line will be inserted that states that the email was sent via ascendbywix.com.
Template is used to create new email marketing campaigns.

members.name: isDynamic
members.doc: If template has dynamic variables, provided by verticals.

docs.summary: Designers create many different thumbnails for template. They are used in different pages and interfaces.

members.name: role
members.doc: Thumbnail image role. There is no strict list of possible roles. Most commonly used: thumbnailFull, default.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ACTIVE - Able to use email marketing normally.
  • WARNED - Must explicitly agree to terms of use to activate account.
  • SUSPENDED - Must fill out compliance questionnaire, unable to use email marketing.
  • BANNED - Able to open a support ticket, unable to use email marketing.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • EMAIL_MARKETING - Regular email marketing campaign.
  • INVITATION - mobile place invitation email
  • AUTOMATION - automation
  • TRIGGERED - triggered email

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • WEB
  • MOBILE

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • LOW_ENGAGEMENT
  • SENDER_DETAILS
  • SPAM_TRAPS
  • OTHER
  • ADULT_SEXUAL_CONTENT
  • AFFILIATE_MARKETING
  • BETTING_OR_GAMBLING
  • CREDIT_REPAIR_OR_DEBT_RELIEF
  • GET_RICH_QUICK_SCHEME
  • ILLEGAL_SUBSTANCES_OR_WEAPONS
  • MISLEADING_SUBJECT_LINE
  • TRADING_OR_CRYPTOCURRENCIES
  • UNSOLICITED_CONTENT

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ACTIVE - Campaign is active.
  • ARCHIVED - Campaign is archived.
  • DELETED - Campaign is deleted.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • DRAFT - Campaign not yet published.
  • PUBLISHED - Campaign published.
  • TEMPLATE - Campaign is a template.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • NOT_STARTED - Campaign not yet distributed via emails.
  • SCHEDULED - Campaign scheduled for distribution.
  • IN_DETECTION - Campaign is being automatically screened for malicious content.
  • IN_MODERATION - Campaign is being manually reviewed by moderators.
  • SAMPLING - A fraction of recipients is selected as a sample and its performance will be assessed to determine further action.
  • SENDING - Campaign is being distributed to all recipients.
  • REJECTED - Campaign was rejected.
  • TERMINATED - Campaign was terminated after unsuccessful sampling.
  • DISTRIBUTED - Campaign fully distributed to recipients.
  • PAUSED - Scheduled campaign has been paused.

Possible values are:
  • DRAFT - Campaign not yet published.
  • REVIEW - Campaign is being reviewed.
  • REJECTED - Campaign was rejected.
  • SCHEDULED - Campaign is scheduled.
  • PAUSED - Scheduled campaign was paused.
  • PUBLISHED - Campaign is published.
  • SENDING - Campaign is being send.
  • PARTIALLY_SENT - Campaign was partially sent. Happens when too many recipients bounce.
  • SENT - Campaign was sent.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • PLAIN_TEXT
  • HTML
  • LIVE_SITE_LINK
  • BACKOFFICE_LINK
  • MONEY
  • DATETIME
  • DATETIME_WITH_TIMEZONE
  • ENUM

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • DELIVERED
  • OPENED
  • CLICKED
  • BOUNCED
  • NOT_SENT

The type of email activity that triggered the webhook. Possible values are:
  • DELIVERY - Triggered when email is delivered to the recipient.
  • CLICK - Triggered when the recipient clicks on an url inside of the email.
  • OPEN - Triggered when the email is opened by the recipient.
  • SOFT_BOUNCE - Triggered when the email is bounced softly.
  • HARD_BOUNCED - Triggered when the email bounces.
